required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Expanded Access Program Providing Flotetuzumab in the Treatment of Acute Myeloid Leukemia Patients in Single, Individually-approved Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the Expanded Access program is to provide flotetuzumab to patients with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) for whom potential benefit justifies potential treatment risks.

detailed_description.textblock: MacroGenics will consider, on a case-by-case basis, requests by treating physicians to file a single patient investigational new drug application for expanded access to flotetuzumab and for MacroGenics to supply flotetuzumab for single patient use.

intervention.description: CD123 x CD3 bispecific DARTÂ® antibody

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Weight of at least 17 kilograms
- CD123-positive hematologic malignancy
- Adequate organ reserve
- Provider and site are trained on study protocol using flotetuzumab
Exclusion Criteria:
- AML that meets inclusion criteria for study CP-MGD006-01 (NCT02152956)
- Primary induction failure
- Early relapse (less than 6 months after first complete remission )
- Three prior lines of therapy, including maximum of 1 prior salvage attempts
